intro: Herpestis salzmannii, commonly known as Salzmann's herb, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is native to the Canary Islands and is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, greenish-yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or coastal areas, adapting to the harsh environmental conditions of its habitat. Its leaves are compound, with a feathery appearance, and it produces small, dry fruits that contain seeds. Due to its limited distribution and specific ecological requirements, it is considered a rare and vulnerable species.
